text:
sawaddee ka welcome to hot Thai kitchen I am 
super excited about today's recipe because if

you recall last summer I made a dessert called 
mango coconut jelly now that video very quickly

became my most viewed video of all time and 
the thing is that recipe is actually my take

on a more traditional dessert and that's what 
we're going to make today so what we're making

is called woon gati maprao on so woon
is agar agar jelly which is what we're going to

use to set the jelly gati is coconut milk and 
maprao on is young coconut so it's jelly with two

different layers super beautiful and refreshing 
as well again wait so let's get started now I've

talked about agar agar extensively and I have a 
whole video that answers all of your questions

most of your questions about it but just very 
quickly agar agar is similar to gelatin in a

sense that it sets liquid into a gel however it 
has a very different texture and just plant base

now the one that I am using is agar agar powder 
and I want to point that out because if you're

using a different form of agar agar say flakes 
or threads or it comes in a few different forms

you're going to need a different amount and I'll 
include all that information in the written recipe

and one thing I am going to tell you that I didn't 
tell you last time is when you buy a ghagra check

the ingredient list there should be one thing on 
it only and that is agar agar there should not

be sugar there should not be color because those 
products exist as well and if you're not careful

you get one that's basically an instant mix that 
you just have to add water and that's not what you

want right so in this pot I've got some coconut 
water and you can get coconut water either from

a young coconut if you can get one of those or you 
can buy prepackaged coconut water which is widely

available these days at least in North America 
however make sure it is a hundred percent coconut

water with no sugar or flavoring added to it and 
to taste it and make sure you actually like there

are brands out there that it's not very sweet it's 
very bland not very flavorful so give it a taste

it should be sweet and really quite aromatic so 
to this I'm going to add my agar powder and you

always want to add agar powder when the liquid 
is cold okay because if you add it when it's

hot it'll like to clump together and then you 
have to worry about getting rid of the clumps

and all that stuff I'm going to add the white part 
which is coconut milk you can customize how creamy

you like it by changing the ratio between coconut 
milk and coconut water what I'm doing now is 50:50

equal parts of both now I'm going to bring this 
to a boil a little bit of salt I find that the

little bit of saltiness balances the creaminess of 
the coconut milk really well and I'm going to add

some sugar the amount of sugar you add is going 
to depend on how sweet your coconut water is so I

would add less give it a space at the end and then 
if you need to add more you can add more now I am

going to add sort of like our version of vanilla 
which is pendant leaves now I have finally have a

whole one to show you and it's incredibly long now 
this is a big one but it's a beautiful aroma that

we like to add to pretty much all our desserts so 
for this amount I'm only going to add like this

much okay cuz it can be a bit overpowering put 
that in and let it come to a boil with the liquid

now you want to stir this frequently because if 
you don't the agar agar will settle to the bottom

and it will gel at the bottom alright so you want 
to bring it to a full boil because when it boils

that's how you know the agar agar is completely 
dissolved so normally what I would do is actually

make two layers at the same time and I'm like 
stirring with two hands so that way it's done you

know at the same time but I only have one stove 
over here so I'm just gonna put this away but I

need to keep this hot okay so the second layer 
is almost exactly the same except we're doing

all coconut water see this is why it's really 
important that your coconut water is too see

because it is a predominant flavor in this dessert 
so got some coconut water here and going in with

the agar powder again give it a stir to distribute 
the little powders so I'm adding less sugar

because I have more coconut water so I have more 
natural sweetness in this pot I'm going in also

with my pandan leaf all right I'm going to bring 
this again to a boil keep stirring and that's it

it's like the easiest dessert in the world so my 
coconut water layers come to a boil all right now

it's time to build the layers so you can build 
this however you want if you're really lazy just

pour one let it set and pour the other one on top 
of it just like I did my mango coconut version

just two layers easiest but if you have time and 
you want it to look impressive then you take the

time to create multiple layers which is what I'm 
going to do so I'm going to start with the coconut

layer it really doesn't matter which one you start 
with but I think this looks nicer and I'm going

to divide the coconut layer into three equal parts 
I'm just going to pour it in pour it in gently you

don't want to create bubbles now oh shoot bubbles 
oh well so I'm gonna just remove the bubbles just

spoon it out there you go now this is going in the 
fridge five minutes set the timer cause you don't

want it to be completely completely cold it's 
been five minutes and it's still warm the test

is you just kind of tap it around the edges and 
if you can touch it without it being liquid then

it's good to go you don't want it completely cold 
because that's one of the problems that happened

with a lot of people when they made my mango video 
is that the layers don't stick together and they

sort of fall apart at the end and that's because 
the bottom layer is too cold and the top layer the

new layer is not hot enough so what you want is 
this to be as warm as you can for everything to be

as warm as you can solicit a sort of fuse together 
ever so lightly at the surface so you can cut and

serve it and it holds its shape right so I've got 
now my coconut water layer for this I'm only going

to need two layers so I'm measure out just one 
cup you want to pour this as delicately as you

can and so I like to pour it over the spoon and I 
let it drizzle onto the corner because the corner

is going to be the firmest place right because it 
sets from the outside in and then I just switch it

up a little bit so I don't stress out that part so 
c-note my lair is steaming hot so I kept this on

low flame now this is going to take a little bit 
longer this will take about seven minutes another

thing to note is it's the layers are never going 
to be come one solid block okay but what we're

trying to prevent is it falling apart while you're 
serving so it should stick together well enough

that you can serve it without it falling apart but 
if you try to peel them apart they will come apart

quite cleanly okay so if that happens to you 
oh it still comes off it's it's totally normal

here's the moment it's cold it's ready 
to serve what I want to do is I want nice

cubes so I'm going to trim off the edges a 
little bit I'm going to turn out the whole

thing so what you need for that is to get 
a flat metal spatula or something that's

very thin and you just go along the side and 
just sort of dislodge it a little bit okay and

then you hope and pray that it all comes 
out in one piece and up now why is it not

that should not come out as smoothly as I'd 
hope but that's okay the sides are mangled

is not a big deal because I'm gonna trim off 
the edges and then you can snack on these and

then you can just cut it into whatever shape or 
cube you like and there you go okay here we go

mmm need another piece oh it's so tropical 
that just reminds me of home like seriously

this is probably the most common type 
of Agra jelly you can find in Thailand

so when I taste that it's like yep that's 
Highland that comb that stuff I grew well

fought there's just the perfect balance of 
light and refreshing in the creaminess in

that little bit of coconut milk oh it's so 
good I hope you enjoyed this recipe and the

recipe as always will be on hot thai kitchen 
calm when you make it please send me a photo

it's so pretty I would love to see how you 
make it and if you haven't subscribed to the

show please do so right here and I will see 
you next time for you next to the cheese hi
